message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.GR, cs.MM

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) category as it deals with colorization of images using deep neural networks. It also involves designing an appropriate loss function, which is a common technique in computer vision research. 

The paper also involves the use of deep learning techniques, which makes it likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) category. 

The paper's focus on designing a loss function to differentiate the influence of input data, global inputs, and local inputs suggests that it may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) category. 

The paper's use of a global color theme recommendation system suggests that it may also belong to the Graphics (cs.GR) category. 

Finally, the paper's use of experimental results to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method suggests that it may also belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) category.
